p: Due to the lack of isolation units in the country, MOH with support from DFID through WHO procured five tents, each with a 20-bed capacity designed to serve as emergency isolation facility that can quickly be deployed in case of a VHF outbreak. Assorted drugs, medical supplies and over 2000 sets of personal protective equipment were also procured and pre-positioned at RRHs and district hospitals. The same funding additionally supported the ports of entry(POE) surveillance at the Entebbe International Airport through the acquisition of a walk-through thermal scanner and baseline assessment for IHR capacities at ground POE.
